The systemic inflammation caused by SARS-CoV-2 may also cause stroke through destabilisation of atheromatous plaques, as is thought to occur during influenza epidemics. Systemic inflammation ruptures the fibrous cap of the atheroma, exposing the thrombogenic material.
38 This hypothesis was proposed as an explanation for acute coronary syndromes observed during the 2003 SARS-CoV epidemic.
